postBySlug.html:
Layers

Layer is used to organize related shapes on a diagram control. A layer is a named category of shapes. By assigning shapes to different layers, you can selectively view, remove, and lock different categories of shapes.

In diagram, Layers provide a way to change the properties of all shapes that have been assigned to that layer. The following properties can be set.

  • Visible
  • Lock
  • Objects
  • AddInfo

Visible

The layerâ€™s Visible property is used to control the visibility of the elements assigned to the layer.

@* initialize diagram component *@
<EjsDiagram id="diagram" @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" @ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node*@
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" StrokeColor="white"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="node1">
                    @*Customizes the appearance of the annotations*@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node shadow style*@
            <DiagramShadow Angle="50" Opacity="0.8" Distance="9"></DiagramShadow>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    @* initialize diagram layers *@
    <DiagramLayers>
        <DiagramLayer Id="layer1" Objects="@nodes" Visible="false"></DiagramLayer>
    </DiagramLayers>
</EjsDiagram>

@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    string[] nodes = new string[] { "node1" };
}

Lock

The layerâ€™s Lock property is used to prevent or allow changes to the elements dimension and position.

@* initialize diagram component *@
<EjsDiagram id="diagram" @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" @ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node*@
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" StrokeColor="white"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="node1">
                    @*Customizes the appearance of the annotations*@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node shadow style*@
            <DiagramShadow Angle="50" Opacity="0.8" Distance="9"></DiagramShadow>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    @* initialize diagram layers *@
    <DiagramLayers>
        @* Enable Lock for the Layer*@
        <DiagramLayer Id="layer1" Objects="@nodes" Visible="true" Lock="true"></DiagramLayer>
    </DiagramLayers>
</EjsDiagram>

@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    string[] nodes = new string[] { "node1" };
}

Objects

The layerâ€™s Objects property defines the diagram elements to the layer.

@* initialize diagram component *@
<EjsDiagram id="diagram" @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" @ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node*@
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" StrokeColor="white"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="node1">
                    @*Customizes the appearance of the annotations*@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node shadow style*@
            <DiagramShadow Angle="50" Opacity="0.8" Distance="9"></DiagramShadow>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    @* initialize diagram layers *@
    <DiagramLayers>
        @* Enable Lock for the Layer*@
        <DiagramLayer Id="layer1" Objects="@nodes" Visible="true"></DiagramLayer>
    </DiagramLayers>
</EjsDiagram>

@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    string[] nodes = new string[] { "node1" };
}

AddInfo

The AddInfo property of layers allow you to maintain additional information to the layers.

The following code illustrates how to add additional information to the layers.

@* initialize diagram component *@
<EjsDiagram id="diagram" @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" @ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node*@
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" StrokeColor="white"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="node1">
                    @*Customizes the appearance of the annotations*@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node shadow style*@
            <DiagramShadow Angle="50" Opacity="0.8" Distance="9"></DiagramShadow>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    @* initialize diagram layers *@
    <DiagramLayers>
        @* Enable Lock for the Layer*@
        <DiagramLayer Id="layer1" Objects="@nodes" Visible="true" AddInfo="@addInfo"></DiagramLayer>
    </DiagramLayers>
</EjsDiagram>

@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    string[] nodes = new string[] { "node1" };
    string addInfo = "Layer1";
}

Add layer at runtime

Layers can be added at runtime by using the AddLayer public method.

The layerâ€™s Id property defines the Id of the layer, and its further used to find the layer at runtime and do any customization.

The following code illustrates how to add a layer.

<button id="button1" onclick="@AddLayer">Add</button>
@* initialize diagram component *@
<EjsDiagram id="diagram" @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" @ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node*@
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" StrokeColor="white"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="node1">
                    @*Customizes the appearance of the annotations*@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node shadow style*@
            <DiagramShadow Angle="50" Opacity="0.8" Distance="9"></DiagramShadow>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    @* initialize diagram layers *@
    <DiagramLayers>
        @* Enable Lock for the Layer*@
        <DiagramLayer Id="layer1" Objects="@nodes" Visible="true" AddInfo="@addInfo"></DiagramLayer>
    </DiagramLayers>
</EjsDiagram>


@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    string[] nodes = new string[] { "node1" };
    string addInfo = "Layer1";
     public void AddLayer()
    {
        //Add layer at runtime
        diagram.AddLayer("layer1");
    }
}

Remove layer at runtime

Layers can be removed at runtime by using the RemoveLayer public method.

The following code illustrates how to remove a layer.

<button id="button1" onclick="@RemoveLayer">remove</button>
@* initialize diagram component *@
<EjsDiagram id="diagram" @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" @ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node*@
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" StrokeColor="white"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="node1">
                    @*Customizes the appearance of the annotations*@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node shadow style*@
            <DiagramShadow Angle="50" Opacity="0.8" Distance="9"></DiagramShadow>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    @* initialize diagram layers *@
    <DiagramLayers>
        @* Enable Lock for the Layer*@
        <DiagramLayer Id="layer1" Objects="@nodes" Visible="true" AddInfo="@addInfo"></DiagramLayer>
    </DiagramLayers>
</EjsDiagram>


@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    string[] nodes = new string[] { "node1" };
    string addInfo = "Layer1";
     public void RemoveLayer()
    {
        //Remove layer at runtime
        diagram.RemoveLayer("layer1");
    }
}

MoveObjects

Objects of the layers can be moved by using the MoveObjects public method.

The following code illustrates how to move objects from one layer to another layer from the diagram.

<button id="button1" onclick="@MoveObjects">MoveObjects</button>
<EjsDiagram id="diagram" @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" @ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node*@
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" StrokeColor="white"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="node1">
                    @*Customizes the appearance of the annotations*@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node shadow style*@
            <DiagramShadow Angle="50" Opacity="0.8" Distance="9"></DiagramShadow>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    <DiagramConnectors>
        <DiagramConnector Id="connector1" Type=@Segments.Orthogonal ZIndex="1">
            <ConnectorSourcePoint X="100" Y="100"></ConnectorSourcePoint>
            <ConnectorTargetPoint X="300" Y="300"></ConnectorTargetPoint>
        </DiagramConnector>
    </DiagramConnectors>
    <DiagramLayers>
        <DiagramLayer Id="layer1" Objects="@nodes" Visible="true" AddInfo="@addInfo"></DiagramLayer>
    </DiagramLayers>
</EjsDiagram>
@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    string[] nodes = new string[] { "node1" };
    string addInfo = "Layer1";
    string[] obj1 = new string[] { "connector1" };
    public void MoveObjects()
    {
        // move the objects of diagram layers
        diagram.MoveObjects(obj1, "layer1");
    }
}

BringLayerForward

Layers can be moved forward at runtime by using the BringLayerForward public method.

The following code illustrates how to bring forward to layer.

@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    public void BringLayerForward()
    {
        // move the layer forward
        this.diagram.BringLayerForward("layer1");
    }
}

SendLayerBackward

Layers can be moved backward at runtime by using the SendLayerBackward public method.

The following code illustrates how to send backward to layer.

@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    public void SendLayerBackward()
    {
        // move the layer backward
        this.diagram.SendLayerBackward("layer1");
    }
}

CloneLayer

Layers can be cloned with its object by using the CloneLayer public method.

The following code illustrates how to bring forward to layer.

<button id="button1" onclick="@CloneLayer">CloneLayer</button>
<EjsDiagram id="diagram" @ref="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" @ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node*@
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" StrokeColor="white"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="node1">
                    @*Customizes the appearance of the annotations*@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
            @*Customizes the appearance of the node shadow style*@
            <DiagramShadow Angle="50" Opacity="0.8" Distance="9"></DiagramShadow>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    <DiagramLayers>
        <DiagramLayer Id="layer1" Objects="@nodes" Visible="true" AddInfo="@addInfo"></DiagramLayer>
    </DiagramLayers>
</EjsDiagram>
@functions{
    EjsDiagram diagram;
    DiagramNode node1;
    string[] nodes = new string[] { "node1" };
    string addInfo = "Layer1";
    string[] obj1 = new string[] { "connector1" };
    public void CloneLayer()
    {
        // clone a layer with its object
        diagram.CloneLayer("layer1");
    }
}

GetActiveLayer

To get the active layers back in diagram, use the GetActiveLayer public method.

The following code illustrates how to bring forward to layer.

// gets the active layer back
diagram.GetActiveLayer();

SetActiveLayer

Set the active layer by using the SetActiveLayer public method.

The following code illustrates how to bring forward to layer.

// set the active layer
//@param layerName defines the name of the layer which is to be active layer
diagram.SetActiveLayer('layer1');
postBySlug.excerpt: Layers Layer  is used to organize related shapes on a diagram control. A layer is a named category of shapes. By assigning shapes toâ€¦

previous.html:
Native events

The Diagram control provides event support, which triggers while interacting with the diagram. Also, Syncfusion provides native event support in blazor for the following events

Event Name Event Type
onfocus UIFocusEventArgs
onclick UIMouseEventArgs
onmousemove UIMouseEventArgs
onmouseover UIMouseEventArgs
onmouseout UIMouseEventArgs
onmousedown UIMouseEventArgs
onmouseup UIMouseEventArgs
ondblclick UIMouseEventArgs
onkeydown UIKeyboardEventArgs
onkeyup UIKeyboardEventArgs
ondrop UIDragEventArgs

The native events can be defined as mentioned below. For example, the onmousedown event in diagram.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" @onmousedown="@onmousedown"></EjsDiagram>

@functions {
    public void onmousedown(UIMouseEventArgs args)
    {
        //Action to be performed
    }
}

fields.seoContent: Native Events in ASP.NET Core Blazor [Preview] Diagram | Syncfusion Documentation

next.html:
Annotation

Annotation is a block of text that can be displayed over a node or connector. Annotation is used to textually represent an object with a string that can be edited at runtime. Multiple annotations can be added to a node/connector.

Create annotation

An annotation can be added to a node/connector by defining the annotation object and adding that to the annotation collection of the node/connector. The Content property of annotation defines the text to be displayed. The following code illustrates how to create a annotation.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            @* To set the annotation for the diagram node*@
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Content="Node">
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    <DiagramConnectors>
        <DiagramConnector Id="connector1">
            <ConnectorSourcePoint X="100" Y="100"></ConnectorSourcePoint>
            <ConnectorTargetPoint X="300" Y="300"></ConnectorTargetPoint>
            @* To set the annotation for the diagram connector*@
            <DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
                <DiagramConnectorAnnotation Content="Connector">
                    <ConnectorAnnotationStyle Fill="transparent" Color="black"></ConnectorAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramConnectorAnnotation>
            </DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
        </DiagramConnector>
    </DiagramConnectors>
</EjsDiagram>

Alignment

Annotation can be aligned relative to the node boundaries. It has Margin, Offset, horizontal, and vertical alignment settings. It is quite tricky when all four alignments are used together but gives more control over alignment.

Offset

The offset property of annotation is used to align the annotations based on fractions. 0 represents top/left corner, 1 represents bottom/right corner, and 0.5 represents half of width/height.

Set the size for a nodes annotation by using Width and Height properties.

The following code shows the relationship between the annotation position (black color circle) and offset (fraction values).

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                @* Set offset to the annotation *@
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="group">
                    <NodeAnnotationOffset X="0" Y="1"></NodeAnnotationOffset>
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Horizontal and vertical alignment

The HorizontalAlignment property of annotation is used to set how the annotation is horizontally aligned at the annotation position determined from the fraction values. The VerticalAlignment property is used to set how annotation is vertically aligned at the annotation position.

The following tables illustrates all the possible alignments visually with â€˜offset (0, 0)â€˜.

Horizontal Alignment Vertical Alignment Output with Offset(0,0)
Left Top
Center Top
Right Top
Left Center
Center Center
Right Center
Left Bottom
Center Bottom
Right Bottom

The following codes illustrates how to align annotations.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                    @*Sets to align label horizontally/vertically relative to given offset*@
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="group" HorizontalAlignment="@HorizontalAlignment.Left" VerticalAlignment="@VerticalAlignment.Top">
                    <NodeAnnotationOffset X="0" Y="0"></NodeAnnotationOffset>
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Annotation alignment with respect to segments

The offset and alignment properties of annotation allows you to align the connector annotations with respect to the segments.

The following code example illustrates how to align connector annotations.

  <EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    @* Intialize the nodes *@
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Node">
                    <NodeAnnotationOffset X="0" Y="0"></NodeAnnotationOffset>
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
        <DiagramNode Id="node2" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="300">
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Annotation">
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    @* Intialize the connectors *@
    <DiagramConnectors>
        <DiagramConnector Id="connector" SourceID="node1" TargetID="node2">
            <DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
                @* Sets the position of the label with respect to the segment and Aligns the label either top or left(after) of the connector segment *@
                <DiagramConnectorAnnotation Content="1" Offset="1" Alignment="@AnnotationAlignment.Before">
                    <ConnectorAnnotationStyle Fill="transparent" Color="black"></ConnectorAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramConnectorAnnotation>
                <DiagramConnectorAnnotation Content="0" Offset="0" Alignment="@AnnotationAlignment.Before">
                    <ConnectorAnnotationStyle Fill="transparent" Color="black"></ConnectorAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramConnectorAnnotation>
            </DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
        </DiagramConnector>
    </DiagramConnectors>
</EjsDiagram>

Margin

Margin is an absolute value used to add some blank space in any one of its four sides. The annotations can be displaced with the margin property. The following code example illustrates how to align a annotation based on its Offset, HorizontalAlignment, VerticalAlignment, and Margin values.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    @* Intialize the nodes *@
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" HorizontalAlignment="@HorizontalAlignment.Left" VerticalAlignment="@VerticalAlignment.Center">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Node">
                    @* Sets margin to add annotation in top of a node *@
                    <NodeAnnotationMargin Top="10"></NodeAnnotationMargin>
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
        <DiagramNode Id="node2" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="300" OffsetY="300">
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Annotation" HorizontalAlignment="@HorizontalAlignment.Left" VerticalAlignment="@VerticalAlignment.Center">
                    @* Sets margin to add annotation in bottom of a connector *@
                    <NodeAnnotationMargin Bottom="10"></NodeAnnotationMargin>
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" Color="white" StrokeColor="None"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    @* Intialize the connectors *@
    <DiagramConnectors>
        <DiagramConnector Id="connector" SourceID="node1" TargetID="node2">
            <DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
                <DiagramConnectorAnnotation Content="Comnnector1" Offset="1">
                    <ConnectorAnnotationStyle Fill="transparent" Color="black"></ConnectorAnnotationStyle>
                    @* Sets margin to add annotation in top of a connector *@
                    <ConnectorAnnotationMargin Top="10"></ConnectorAnnotationMargin>
                </DiagramConnectorAnnotation>
            </DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
        </DiagramConnector>
    </DiagramConnectors>
</EjsDiagram>

Text align

The TextAlign property of annotation allows you to set how the text should be aligned (left, right, center, or justify) inside the text block. The following codes illustrate how to set textAlign for an annotation.

 <EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" HorizontalAlignment="@HorizontalAlignment.Left" VerticalAlignment="@VerticalAlignment.Center">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Node">
                    @* Text align is set as Left *@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Fill="#6BA5D7" Color="white" TextAlign="@TextAlign.Right"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Hyperlink

Diagram provides a support to add a Hyperlink for the nodes/connectors annotation. It can also be customized.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Width="200" Height="150" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" Id="node1">
            @* Sets the hyperlink annotation for the node *@
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation>
                    <NodeHyperlink Link="https://www.syncfusion.com/" Content="Syncfusion"></NodeHyperlink>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Template Support for Annotation

Diagram provides template support for annotation. you should define a SVG/HTML content as string in the annotationâ€™s Template property.

The following code illustrates how to define a template in nodeâ€™s annotation. similarly, you can define it in connectors.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" ref="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100" HorizontalAlignment="@HorizontalAlignment.Left" VerticalAlignment="@VerticalAlignment.Center">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                @* Define a SVG/HTML content as string in the annotation for the node *@
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Node" Template="@template">
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="white" Fill="transparent"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
    <DiagramConnectors>
        <DiagramConnector Id="connector">
            <ConnectorSourcePoint X="100" Y="100"></ConnectorSourcePoint>
            <ConnectorTargetPoint X="300" Y="200"></ConnectorTargetPoint>
            <DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
                @* Define a SVG/HTML content as string in the annotation for the connector *@
                <DiagramConnectorAnnotation Content="Comnnector1" Offset="0" Template="@template"></DiagramConnectorAnnotation>
            </DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
        </DiagramConnector>
    </DiagramConnectors>
</EjsDiagram>

Wrapping

When text overflows node boundaries, you can control it by using TextWrap. So, it is wrapped into multiple lines. The wrapping property of annotation defines how the text should be wrapped. The following code illustrates how to wrap a text in a node.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Annotation Text Wrapping">
                    @* Enables Text-wrapping *@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="black" Fill="transparent" TextWrapping="@TextWrap.Wrap"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>
Value Description Image
No Wrap Text will not be wrapped.
Wrap Text-wrapping occurs, when the text overflows beyond the available node width.
WrapWithOverflow (Default) Text-wrapping occurs, when the text overflows beyond the available node width. However, the text may overflow beyond the node width in the case of a very long word.

Text overflow

The labelâ€™s TextOverflow property is used control whether to display the overflowed content in node or not.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Annotation Text Wrapping">
                    @* Sets the Text overflow for the annotations *@
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="black" Fill="transparent" TextOverflow="@TextOverflow.Ellipsis"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Appearance

  • You can change the font style of the annotations with the font specific properties (fontSize, fontFamily, color). The following code illustrates how to customize the appearance of the annotation.

  • The labelâ€™s Bold, Italic, and TextDecoration properties are used to style the labelâ€™s text.

  • The labelâ€™s Fill, StrokeColor, and StrokeWidth properties are used to define the background color and border color of the annotation and the Opacity property is used to define the transparency of the annotations.

  • The Visible property of the annotation enables or disables the visibility of annotation.

The fill, border, and opacity appearances of the text can also be customized with appearance specific properties of annotation. The following code illustrates how to customize background, opacity, and border of the annotation.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Annotation Text Wrapping">
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="black" Fill="transparent" FontFamily="TimesNewRoman" FontSize="12" Bold="true" Italic="true"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Interaction

Diagram allows annotation to be interacted by selecting, dragging, rotating, and resizing. Annotation interaction is disabled, by default. You can enable annotation interaction with the Constraints property of annotation. You can also curtail the services of interaction by enabling either selecting, dragging, rotating, or resizing individually with the respective constraints property of annotation. The following code illustrates how to enable annotation interaction.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Annotation Text Wrapping" Constraints="@AnnotationConstraints.Interaction">
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="black" Fill="transparent" FontFamily="TimesNewRoman" FontSize="12" Bold="true" Italic="true"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Edit

Diagram provides support to edit an annotation at runtime, either programmatically or interactively. By default, annotation is in view mode. But it can be brought to edit mode in two ways;

  • Programmatically By using StartTextEdit method, edit the text through programmatically.

  • Interactively

    1. By double-clicking the annotation.
    2. By selecting the item and pressing the F2 key.

Double-clicking any annotation will enables editing and the node enables first annotation editing. When the focus of editor is lost, the annotation for the node is updated. When you double-click on the node/connector/diagram model, the DoubleClick event gets triggered.

Read-only annotations

Diagram allows to create read-only annotations. You have to set the read-only property of annotation to enable/disable the read-only Constraints. The following code illustrates how to enable read-only mode.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Annotation Text Wrapping" Constraints="@AnnotationConstraints.ReadOnly">
                    <NodeAnnotationStyle Color="black" Fill="transparent" FontFamily="TimesNewRoman" FontSize="12" Bold="true" Italic="true"></NodeAnnotationStyle>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Drag Limit

  • The diagram control now supports defining the DragLimit to the label while dragging from the connector and also update the position to the nearest segment offset.

  • You can set the value to dragLimit Left, Right, Top, and Bottom properties which allow the dragging of connector labels to a certain limit based on the user defined values.

  • By default, drag limit will be disabled for the connector. It can be enabled by setting connector constraints as drag.

  • The following code illustrates how to set a dragLimit for connector annotations.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramConnectors>
        <DiagramConnector Id="connector">
            <ConnectorSourcePoint X="100" Y="100"></ConnectorSourcePoint>
            <ConnectorTargetPoint X="300" Y="200"></ConnectorTargetPoint>
            <DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
                <DiagramConnectorAnnotation Content="Comnnector1" Offset="0" Constraints="@AnnotationConstraints.Interaction">
                    <ConnectorAnnotationDragLimit Left="10" Right="10" Bottom="10" Top="10"></ConnectorAnnotationDragLimit>
                </DiagramConnectorAnnotation>
            </DiagramConnectorAnnotations>
        </DiagramConnector>
    </DiagramConnectors>
</EjsDiagram>

Multiple annotations

You can add any number of annotations to a node or connector. The following code illustrates how to add multiple annotations to a node.

<EjsDiagram ID="diagram" Width="100%" Height="690px">
    <DiagramNodes>
        <DiagramNode Id="node1" Height="100" Width="100" OffsetX="100" OffsetY="100">
            <NodeShapeStyle Fill="darkcyan"></NodeShapeStyle>
            <DiagramNodeAnnotations>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation1" Content="Annotation1">
                    <NodeAnnotationOffset X="0" Y="0"></NodeAnnotationOffset>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation2" Content="Annotation2">
                    <NodeAnnotationOffset X="0" Y="1"></NodeAnnotationOffset>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation3" Content="Annotation3">
                    <NodeAnnotationOffset X="1" Y="0"></NodeAnnotationOffset>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
                <DiagramNodeAnnotation Id="annotation4" Content="Annotation4">
                    <NodeAnnotationOffset X="1" Y="1"></NodeAnnotationOffset>
                </DiagramNodeAnnotation>
            </DiagramNodeAnnotations>
        </DiagramNode>
    </DiagramNodes>
</EjsDiagram>

Constraints

The constraints property of annotation allows you to enable/disable certain annotation behaviours. For instance, you can disable annotation editing.
